result.execSummary:
The defendant Dywan Oscar Coleman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dywan Oscar Coleman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 3:16 pm case called. Defendant Dywan Oscar Coleman in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    Attorney Szilagyi states agreement has been reached and read into record. DA Blader concurs.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court sentences the defendant to : 45 days WCJ, with Good Time credit. Credit for 9 days served. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan.  Appeal Rights Given.

ADDRESS INFO for Dywan Oscar Coleman
Current: 2222 Alied Dr, #7, Madison, WI 53711 United States  (Effective: 05-29-2015)
Prior: 1216 Northland Ave #1, Appleton, WI 54911

Case Called @ 1:18 PM: Defendant Dywan Oscar Coleman in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing via video.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Per SPD:  Eligibility confirmed.  ADA argues as to bond request - $1000 Cash Bond requested.  SPD requests to go off record to discuss resolution with Defendant.  Off Record at 1:22 PM:   ADA states counsel did not reach resolution.  Argument by SPD as to bond - argues for Signature Bond due to the existence of other warrants.  Court infers other jurisdictions will be consulted.  The Court:  $1000 Cash Bond ordered due to pronounced risk of flight.  Infers that inter-county discussions will be coordinated with the other jurisdictions.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.    Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
